full_text:
Case 21-58, Document 39-2, 04/01/2021, 3068530, Page76 of 200
k7e2MaxC kjc
1 the entry of that protective order, as I noted, your Honor, the government is prepared to make a substantial production of discovery.
2
3 Your Honor, in advance of the conference, the government and defense counsel proposed a joint schedule for
4 discovery, motion practice, and a proposed trial date, in
5 particular, the date selected in that schedule with an eye
6 towards assuring that there was sufficient time for the
7 government to do a careful and exhaustive and thorough review
8 of all of the materials that I just referenced to make sure
9 that the government is complying with its discovery obligations
10 in this case, which we take very seriously. We expect that the
11 bulk of the relevant materials will be produced in short order,
12 primarily by the end of this summer, with additional materials
13 to follow primarily in a category I mentioned before, your
14 Honor, of electronically stored information, which is subject
15 to an ongoing privilege review which we discussed and
16 communicated with defense counsel about. We have proposed a
17 scheduling order again to be very thorough in our review of
18 discovery and in files in various places where they may be
19 located and we are taking an expansive and thoughtful approach
20 to our obligations in this case, your Honor.
21
22 THE COURT: Let me just follow up specifically, since
23 you have referenced prior investigative files, to the extent we
24 have seen in other matters issues with complete disclosure of
25
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00019935
